description.title: app description
description.value: Helps you track time spent on tickets.

label.title: This is the title of a setting of the app, this setting is hidden and not shown to users but in this setting we will put the ID of a field that will store the time values

helpText.title: this is the helptext for that previously defined setting
helpText.value: The ID of a custom numeric field that will hold the total time.

label.title: This is the title of a setting of the app, this setting is hidden and not shown to users but in this setting we will put the ID of a field that will store the time values

helpText.title: this is the helptext for that previously defined setting
helpText.value: The ID of a custom numeric field that will hold the time spent on ticket.

label.title: This is an app setting allowing the admin to choose if he wants the timelogs to be shown to his agents or not

helpText.title: this is the helptext for that previously defined setting explaining what it does to the admin
helpText.value: Agents can see timelog activity on tickets.

label.title: This is a checkbox setting label. If the admin checks this box the app will be hidden from any agent who is not an Admin.

helpText.title: This is the explanation helptext of the hide_from_agents checkbox for the admin who is installing the app. It is shown for the time tracking app (app to track time spent on tickets). Submission is the ticket submission (they cannot edit the time before submitting a ticket).
helpText.value: The app will not be shown to agents who do not have the 'Admin' role. This also prevents them from being able to see & edit the time upon submission.

label.title: This is an app setting allowing the admin to choose if he wants the timer controls allowing the agents to pause of reset the timer

helpText.title: this is the helptext for that previously defined setting explaining what it does to the admin
helpText.value: Agents can manually pause or reset the timer.

label.title: this is the label of a checkbox in the settings for the admin, if the admin checks the auto pause setting then we will automatically pause the timer when the agents doesn't look at the ticket

helpText.title: this is the explanation helptext of the auto pause checkbox for the admin who is installing the app
helpText.value: The timer pauses when the agent navigates away from the ticket and resumes when the agent is back on the ticket.

label.title: This is a checkbox setting label as well. What this does is let the agent reset the current time he has spent on a specific ticket using a reset button.

helpText.title: this is the explanation helptext of the reset current time checkbox for the admin who is installing the app
helpText.value: Agents can reset the current time spent on a ticket.

label.title: This is a checkbox setting label as well. If the admin checks that box, when the agent submits a time he will be asked to edit the time that was detected by the system.

helpText.title: this is the explanation helptext of edit time submission checkbox for the admin who is installing the app
helpText.value: Agents can review and edit their time before submitting the ticket.

label.title: This is a checkbox setting lable. If the admin checks this box, the agents will be able to submit time in a simple format which consists of just one number, in minutes: https://www.dropbox.com/s/pw13z83j6qoqktv/Screenshot%202014-08-01%2011.29.46.png

helpText.title: This is the explanation helptext of the simple submission checkbox for the admin who is installing the app: https://www.dropbox.com/s/pw13z83j6qoqktv/Screenshot%202014-08-01%2011.29.46.png
helpText.value: Prompt agents to enter a value in minutes before submitting the ticket

hold.title: first letter of status hold (on hold)

pause.title: Title of the pause button on the app, this will make the timer pause

total_time_spent.title: Label of the timer, following this is a time on the following format HH:MM

play.title: Label of the play button on the app, this will make the timer resume

reset.title: Label of the reset button on the app, this will make the timer go back to 00:00

timelogs.title: This is the label for the timelogs table, the timelogs table are a list of times per agent, kind of the history of the ticket if you will. Following this label will be a table containg time per agent and status of the ticket at the time

agent.title: This is one of the labels of the timelogs column table this column will contain the agent name and last name

time.title: This is one of the labels of the timelogs column table this column will contain the time in minutes and seconds

status.title: This is one of the labels of the timelogs column table this column will contain the status of the zendesk ticket at the time of the update

title.title: This is the label for the timelogs table, the timelogs table are a list of times per agent, kind of the history of the ticket if you will. Following this label will be a table containg time per agent and status of the ticket at the time

csv_export.title: this is an export CSV button that generates a CSV export of the timelog

error.title: This message is displayed to the agent when the app is unable to load timelogs for a ticket
error.value: We are unable to load any timelogs.

empty.title: This is a message being displayed when there are no logs

body.title: this is the body of the modal, this modal contains the time that the agents has spent as calculated by the system he can decide to amend it or move forward with it directly
body.value: This is the amount of time you spent on this ticket. Edit the time, if you need to, then click "Submit time".

close.title: this is a button on the modal to cancel time submission

save.title: This is the validation button for submitting the time from the modal

question.title: A question that gives the user a hint about what could be wrong
question.value: Did you follow the installation instructions for this app and configure both required ticket fields to appear on every ticket form?

solution.title: A suggestion about how to setup the app correctly
solution.value: If not, please see these instructions and go to your ticket forms management page to finalize the setup.

save_hook.title: Error message when the agent forgot to submit the time on this ticket
save_hook.value: You need to submit your time on this ticket.

bad_time_format.title: error message when the agent has submitted time in an incorrect format

negative_time.title: error message when the agent has submitted a negative time
